intro.description: This tutorial guides you through the creation of a database connection.

item.title: Create the Database Connection
item.description:
This step opens the "Database Connection" wizard. Right click on the folder "Metadata/DB Connections" and select the menu "Create a new Connection" (or click the link below).
This wizard creates a connection on your DBMS ( DataBase Management System). At the end, the content of all available databases is displayed in the "DQ Repository" view.

item.title: Content of the connection
item.description: Note: Even when you give a specific database name, all the accessible content of your DBMS is displayed in the "DQ Repository" view. This allows you to explore the content of a database even when you don't know all the names of the catalogs (or schemata). The structural content depends on the type of DBMS, databases can contain catalogs and/or schemata. Click on the question mark of this section for more information.
